qas.question: What Puerto Rican leader did the FBI spy on?
What party was Pedro Albizu Campos part of?
How many times was Pedro Albizu Campos convicted of attacks on US officials?
Who released the Campos operation to the public?
When was the Abizu Campos operation made public?
What independence leader did the CIA spy on?
What spied on the Cuban independence leader?
What U.S. congressman covered up the FBI operation?
What act made the Abizu Campos operation secret?
When did Luis Gutierrez cover up the Abizu Campos operation?

context: The <b6_0>FBI<b6_0/> also spied upon and collected information on Puerto Rican independence leader <a0_0><b5_0>Pedro Albizu Campos<b5_0/><a0_0/> and his <a1_0>Nationalist<a1_0/> political party in the 1930s. Abizu Campos was convicted <a2_0>three<a2_0/> times in connection with deadly attacks on US government officials: in 1937 (Conspiracy to overthrow the government of the United States), in 1950 (attempted murder), and in 1954 (after an armed assault on the US House of Representatives while in session; although not present, Abizu Campos was considered the mastermind). The FBI operation was covert and did not become known until U.S. Congressman <a3_0><b7_0>Luis Gutierrez<b7_0/><a3_0/> had it made public via the <b8_0>Freedom of Information Act<b8_0/> in the <a4_0><b9_0>1980s<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
